message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SOC, cs.CL, cs.CYBER. 

The paper proposes an algorithmic solution to reduce polarization on social media by recommending content that challenges users' point of view. This involves taking into account factors such as the user's estimated polarity, the probability of accepting the recommendation, the polarity of the content, and the popularity of the content being recommended. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Social and Behavioral Sciences (cs.SOC), Computation and Language (cs.CL), and Cybersecurity (cs.CYBER).
